column3: when two people are working it's great the service but when the Latin Lady is by herself she is rude and doesn't know how to serve each person first. I ordered a Mocha and a piece of cake. No one was waiting so I ordered. Then a Latin Lady comes after me. (I'M AFRICAN AMERICAN) She orders and is given coffee n something, then she takes a guy then another. I say excuse me my Mocha . She responded In helping other people hold in don't worry. Her voice was loud and tone was rude. I got my drink after 7 mins later. I won't come here again. I'll stay going to Starbucks.
1st time at this location since it opened years ago! I think of them as Martha Bros. Same family different name. Same GREAT ☕️ mmm. The people watchinf is the best from this window. I SWEAR!
Yummy coffee.  They make really good mochas.

Cumaica Artesanos del Cafe is located behind the SF. Twitter headquarters. The location is great for an immersive sit in to enjoy their good coffee, pastries, pasta salad, and free Wi-Fi. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The SFMTA Mission 14 bus passes in front of the Cafe.
Can’t start my day without a Mexican mocha and Salvadoran quesadilla from here. 🥹♥️ …
Good coffee, friendly staff.  I just had my second visit, and was impressed with both the coffee and food options -- moderate selection but very well curated.  Really nice vibe, great music choices.
Friendly employees, good quality coffee.

This place has amazing coffee! I live super close by and have never walked in until today, but glad I did! I honestly didn’t even realize it was a coffee shop, but the inside was nothing like the outside. Super cute and everything looked delicious, and great prices for SF.
Awesome coffee to juice you up for a nice bike ride

One of a handful in the area that open early, fast service, & friendly staff. I fell in love with their iced latte sweetened w/ brown sugar, the turkey pesto sandwich,  & the chia pudding parfait!! The rest of their grab-n-go Cafe items look delicious as well!!
Amazing and inexpensive coffee, hospitable and polite staffs, could be improved environment

I really like this place. I used to go there everyday when I was studying nearby. Today, I go sometimes to get a great coffee and  fruit's cake. The staff are really friendly and helpful. You can have great coffees out there for cheaper than other places.

My co-workers and I love this place. Nice customer service; lots of working people visit this place; good environment and location;  fresh pastries, juices, coffee; everything is excellent. The owner is very nice as well as his helpers.  I recommend it to everyone.
Can't put my finger about this place on what's missing. Had pastries and capuchino, tasted good.
Great coffee (house cup) and a nice selection of eats to accompany it. Very personable service too makes it my "go to" coffee house on Clement Street!

Although they're across the street from a franchise competitor this place can hold it's own. The coffee is robust, the pastries are fit for anyone who loves locally baked goods. If you have to make a decision when you're across the street don't hesitate and cross the street to Cumaica.

I like to grab a coffee at Cumeica. The staff is friendly and I like to support the locals. The coffee is great and hot, it's important to say, I knew some coffee shops they made only warm coffees. The banana bread is yummy.
Was a nice place to take a break. Clean bathroom too. The coffee was stronger than I like but that's the trend these days

I was there for a work related meeting. Coffee taste is fine although the tables aren't clean all the time. Wifi is really slow but you can sit there as long as you like. There is another Cumaica coffee in Mission street (south part) and I like that one better. They can make the atmospher warmer and friendlier with a simple re decoratation.

A big, sunny spot, with caffeine served cold or hot from Nicaragua.  Wandered in here for a quick breakfast and drink.  Standard options for caffeine consumption are available (I went with my usual Mocha Frappe - it was really good and reasonably priced at $4 for 20oz.).  I also had an asiago bagel with egg, cheese, and ham (also ~$4).  There weren't a ton of bagel options, and bacon and sausage were sadly absent from the menu.  The atmosphere was really great here, though.  High vaulted ceilings and a relatively open layout give it a roomy feel.  It wasn't hard to find a table in the morning.  Be warned, though, there was a ton of sunlight in the morning since the large glass walls face south.  This cuts the available seating without intense sunlight in half.  Fortunately, like Superman, I draw my strength from the Sun. #OneSmallStep
Worst place we’ve had in SF so far. Restrooms out of order and no offering to use the employee restrooms. Though price of products are alright, this was a major disappointment.
Cozy little coffee place. Very nice employees.
I go to this spot a lot. Good coffee, relaxed atmosphere, really easy to pop-in, and great location.
Was headed to Peet's as I needed a relatively quiet place to do some work, ran into Cumaica Coffee.  I'm glad I did, the caramel Mac was just the right amount of bitter sweet.  Highly recommended
Great folks, good coffee, tasty baked stuff.

Cumaica is always great. They make great Esspreso or any type of Late. Mexican Late with Almond Milk is awesome. Good thing is their coffee or non coffee drinks are not too sweet or with too much sugar.  On hot days the iced drinks or blended cold drinks are my favorite. A blended Matcha Lata with Almond milk is always good on a hot day.  We also buy or coffee beans here as they have great blends.
Great coffee shop with a chill vibe, decent prices, good coffee, wifi, and good music. I'll be back.
Great place!  Very good coffee, good pastries and bagels, really nice people who work there, and spacious feel.  It is a warm and inviting coffee shop.
The breakfast is the best and coffee is great the workers really cool
This place is amazing. They have phone charging batteries to use while you are enjoying one of their delicious coffees. The hot or iced Moca with Mexican chocolate is delicious.

This is a four-star place if your top priority isn't the quality of the coffee. Good food offerings, really friendly people, open at convenient hours and altogether a good experience. Just not quite the same level of beans as ritual, four barrel Etc
Good coffee and bagel sandwiches, but pretty much the same as others in the area. Nothing special really stands out to review about.

I collect best places to spend my $ when I wfh- this is only 1hr of wifi. Should've just went to Peet's but the reviews were high  Bagel mediocre and coffee could get anywhere  If you need a quick one great - otherwise go to Philz/ Peet's anywhere else to spend the day

I found this coffee shop when walking on Clement for its Sunday farmer's market.  It's a small cafe with some unique coffee drinks.  I had an ice mocha which was great.  The drink was freshly made (no powder) and the espresso was strong.  Not too much chocolate to make it overly sweet.  Overall a good option if you are around the area.
Great coffee. Friendly staff. Hugz
Feels like a vast lobby because of high ceilings. Good, fast cafe from Nicaragua with reasonable prices. Also has bagels and sandwiches and pre-made stuff. Friendly Spanish-American baristas.

I've grabbed coffee or ice tea here a number of times and can't think of a single standout moment. The coffee is fine, the lattes aren't and the ice tea decent. There's a lot of food for the taking, but I've just never eaten here. If you're desperate for caffeine go for it, otherwise walk a few blocks,  you'll find better.
Great breakfast snack options. Coffee is great. I always get an iced coffee. Service is great! Support small local businesses!
Friendly service and the two times I've been here the Americano has been above average.
Got the iced mocha, great! Service was fast and they were very friendly.
I love the people who work here. Make me feel good and happy.
Delicious breakfast burritos, excellent coffee and friendly staff.
Had a whole milk double latte.  Good foam, good flavor.  Nice.

Used to love coming here and still do. But the service has lacked. I waited almosy 20 min for a mexican mocha. The handle a bunch of people that came after me and now im late for aork. Unexceptable. Ive always loved the drink here tho. Ive never experienced this till today. Ben coming for at least 2 or 3 years.
The Bomb!!! Highly recommended
Very friendly staff and quick service. Reasonable price for food and good coffee :) yum yum!
Reasonable prices, but the quality of the coffee drinks isn't as consistent as it used to be when the young man made the drinks.
Let's just say the 3rd time was NOT a charm.  And neither were the attitudes of the baristas.  I will gladly walk further and pay more, for a pleasant experience.
The place itself is okay, a bit shabby. Appreciated the willingness to make an iced earl grey tea with honey for me, which wasn't on the menu.
Really nice place to have a coffee. The staff are super friendly.
Awesome staff, good coffee...
Likable and good coffees. Next to twitter, sf FitnessSF, Twitter's little apartment tower cross the street, good weed club too. Nice Portegese name....
Very good coffee. I truly enjoyed every morning. Must try their Lox (salmon) bagel.

Sadly inflation seems to have hit the most elementary:  No longer the best, sadly changed Oatmilk to the Kirkland brand which has a terrible after taste in a cortado.  I tried making them at home with this brand and they tasted just as bad as they do here. Sadly they have nice coffee but it takes a beating with this cheep substitute.   This is the second time I have tried here but alas unless getting real milk, taste has now been devalued.  When going to a coffee house, coffee taste should be the number one concern, especially for a $4.50, four oz drink, the smoothness is gone and so am I.  3 years ago:   I’m a Cortado drinker and Cumaica is superb in quality, taste, and most importantly, no matter who makes the drink, consistency!  Down to earth staff with excellent taste in beans and roasting!  They are surrounded by coffee outlets but this is the place I chose when I’m home.

The coffee is too good to be true!  Robert Guerrero, founder of this sweet coffee shop is top-notch. The staff is so sweet, especially Ellie, who keeps Cumaica running in an inviting & friendly atmosphere.  I love this place!
Friendly staff, awesome workspace. I prefer Cumaica over Peet's, which is across the street.

I'd give 3.5 stars if I could - their house coffee is good, and their staff friendly. Food is pretty average fare, although I like their Pumpkin Cheesecake Pound Cake. Their wi-fi policy is really inconsistent - the first time I bought a coffee/bagel I got 100 minutes, then the next time 52.  I wouldn't go out of my way to visit, but it's a decent spot for a cup of coffee if you're passing through.
Nice corner coffee with choices of bagel.
Cumaica is top-notch for coffee drinks and grab and go items. The staff are multilingual,  courteous,  patient and professional.
Thier pudding cake is top notch. Strong wifi. Great place for that coffee break.
This place is better than Starbucks!
Always friendly and great coffee.
Coffee too hot. And too much of it. And it tastes bleh.
Great tasting iced tea. Good customer service. Nice atmosphere.
Really like the coffee, salads and sandwiches here. Always excellent service.
Made every effort to ensure I got what I wanted even though it was a very busy time.  Great coffee!
one of the best coffee in San Francisco California  we aare ALWAYS welcome with a great smile at mornings
Very nice staff with decent pastries and very good pre packaged salads. Little pricey.
I was walking around San Francisco and my phone started to die. They were nice enough to let me use an outlet while I drank my coffee.
The coffee here is excellent, better than the other coffee shops in the neighborhood. Try it.. 😀 …
Faithfully serving it up for the neighborhood! Mas bueno!
A lot of way better options available in the neighborhood. My macchiato was terrible.
It’s been years that I missed the scones in this cafe... definitely the best scone in the world!!!!
I had the brownie. It had a delicious layer of fudge on top. I would rate it 10/10 😄 …
Great cup of coffee.
Everything time I've been here there's usually Latino men oogling at the female customer baristas. Just saying.
It was a nice quiet place to have a drink and visit with my Wife and Father.
Great place, good prices and shorter lines than Starbucks.
Delicious Brew, and they use the Stampt App too.
Great staff! Friendly and great verity of coffees!... Todd from Cleveland,ohio
Very pleasant staff, great beverages, good WiFi.
Great coffee shop! Better than the others nearby!
5 days a week they puor my small as they see me crossing the street that's service
Pat said it's the world's number one coffee shop.
The Mexican Mocha. If you love coffee and chocolate---this is the drink you've been looking for.
Love the attention here. Coffee is great and the pastries are yummy.
Good coffee and great bagels, what else can one ask for?
Quick, friendly, and tasty cup.
The cortado is spicy and smooth at the same time.
Great customer service and delicious coffee.
Great coffee beans and pastries. yum
The salvadorean girl she so nice and very friendly 👍 …
Great lattes and breakfast bagels are consistently good
Great staff – always happy and ready to help with anything.
Coffee was a bit strong for me & was manhandled while there
Excellent coffee
Coffee,  food, service -- all excellent #studyspot
Coffee was okay, but the WiFi did not work.
Locally owned, charming , not intimidating,free WiFi
Great place to have a coffee and more.
Great atmosphere, accesible and great coffe,
Love their Red eye coffee
Good coffee, friendly service
Coffee has a burnt aftertaste
The nicest baristas. They are absurdly friendly!!
cheese danish is the best! and super cheap.
A great cafe for coffee and cookies.
Friendly staff and yummy hot choc
Super Yum and opens early. Really smart.
Awesome food, extravagant service!
Great selections and superb customer service
Crisp service.  Prompt and very friendly.
Fwiw they are open on Sunday from 7am to 2pm.
Fabulous
Pretty nice everyone is smiling!
Breakfast burritos surprisingly good.
Good mex hot chocolate
Amazing caramel coffe!
Slow internet and bland chai latte
Try the iced Mexican Mocha!
Great pancakes and Coffee
Two words for Cumaica: Modern Nostalgia
Little Lucas
Kool.
Really bad croissants.
I love it
Good service.
Fresh Orange Juice
Good
Nice place.  :(
Good servise
good coffee
Coffees Hot ....
Excellent attention Delicious Bagels and hot chocolate
Excellent atention
I love the people who work here and the quality of the coffee
They have an excellent and friendly attention, good service, a very good coffee.
I love your coffee drawing a heart 💗
Very good place to go for a coffee 👌
A place to go for a coffee, eat a snack, chat, with good service
Delicious
